docs.snippet: England, which had been eliminated, drew, 0-0, with Costa Rica on Tuesday in its final game at the 2014 World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: England, which had been eliminated, drew, 0-0, with Costa Rica on Tuesday in its final game at the 2014 World Cup.
docs.abstract: World Cup Roundup; Costa Rica ties England, 0-0, in group stage; will advance in first place from Group D, along with Uruguay in second; other soccer news noted.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: England and Costa Rica Play to 0-0 Draw
headline.main: England Salvages a Point, but Little Else
headline.print_headline: England Salvages a Point, but Little Else

docs.snippet: James Rodríguez scored a brilliant goal and set up two more for Jackson Martínez to lead the way.
docs.lead_paragraph: James Rodríguez scored a brilliant goal and set up two more for Jackson Martínez to lead the way.
docs.abstract: World Cup Roundup; Colombia routes Japan, 4-1, eliminating Asian champion in the group stage; will advance from Group C in top position; other soccer news noted.

headline.main: Colombia Pulls Away From Japan to Win Group C
headline.print_headline: World Cup 2014: Colombia Pulls Away from Japan to Win Its Group

docs.snippet: Uruguay was favored to win Group D, but after losing in the opener to Costa Rica, the team looked like it was buried and would need its own Houdini to escape. Enter the brilliant but mercurial Luis Suárez.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay was favored to win Group D, but after losing in the opener to Costa Rica, the team looked like it was buried and would need its own Houdini to escape. Enter the brilliant but mercurial Luis Suárez.
docs.abstract: Andreas Campomar essay argues that Uruguay has once again shown ability to shine as an underdog in the World Cup, led on by the brilliant and mercurial Luis Suarez; contends that Suarez's transgressions, including racism and latest incident of biting on the field, have not affected his status as a hero to Uruguayans.

headline.seo: Behind Luis Suárez, Uruguay’s World Cup Tradition Endures

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
docs.lead_paragraph: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

byline.original: By ADEEL HASSAN and VICTORIA SHANNON

docs.snippet: The Rolling Stones' Mick Jagger can't get no satisfaction from soccer fans in Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Rolling Stones' Mick Jagger can't get no satisfaction from soccer fans in Brazil.

headline.main: Gimme Shelter: Brazil Mocks Mick as World Cup Jinx
headline.print_headline: Gimme Shelter: Brazil Mocks Mick as World Cup Jinx

docs.snippet: FIFA will work as quickly as possible in its investigation into Uruguayan striker Luis Suarez who apparently bit an Italian defender in a World Cup match on Tuesday, the world soccer governing body said.
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA will work as quickly as possible in its investigation into Uruguayan striker Luis Suarez who apparently bit an Italian defender in a World Cup match on Tuesday, the world soccer governing body said.

headline.main: FIFA Working as Fast as Possible on Suarez
headline.print_headline: FIFA Working as Fast as Possible on Suarez

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez and his Uruguay team mates faced an anxious wait on Wednesday as soccer's governing body FIFA decided whether to expel him from the World Cup for biting an opponent in a match against Italy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez and his Uruguay team mates faced an anxious wait on Wednesday as soccer's governing body FIFA decided whether to expel him from the World Cup for biting an opponent in a match against Italy.

headline.main: Suarez and Uruguay Sweat Ahead of FIFA Ruling on Bite
headline.print_headline: Suarez and Uruguay Sweat Ahead of FIFA Ruling on Bite

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez can learn to stop biting opponents but it will not be a quick or easy process, senior psychologists have said following the Uruguay striker's bite on the shoulder of Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini at the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez can learn to stop biting opponents but it will not be a quick or easy process, senior psychologists have said following the Uruguay striker's bite on the shoulder of Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini at the World Cup.

headline.main: Suarez Can Stop Biting, but It Won't Be Easy: Psychologists
headline.print_headline: Suarez Can Stop Biting, but It Won't Be Easy: Psychologists

docs.snippet: Biting opponents, racist comments — all that looked to be behind Luis Suarez, as soccer's bad boy was maturing into a star for his club and country. Then, the old habit that most people leave behind in nursery school cropped up again in front...
docs.lead_paragraph: Biting opponents, racist comments — all that looked to be behind Luis Suarez, as soccer's bad boy was maturing into a star for his club and country. Then, the old habit that most people leave behind in nursery school cropped up again in front of an audience of millions.

headline.main: Soccer's Bad Boy Bites Opponent at World Cup
headline.print_headline: Soccer's Bad Boy Bites Opponent at World Cup
